position.marginalia_text: À uiro in virum quotidiè, vt Eudromus: quotidiè à sopho in sophum. Semper vir, semper.

marginalia.translation: Daily from a man into man, as Eudromus: daily from a wise man into a wise man. Always a man, always.

position.marginalia_text: Plus, plusq[ue] viri à die in diem: plus, plusq[ue] sophi ab hora in horam.

marginalia.translation: More and more man, from day by day: more and more a wise man, from hour to hour.

position.marginalia_text: Qui non proficit à momento in momentum, deficit.

marginalia.translation: He who does not accomplish moment by moment fails.

position.marginalia_text: Qui non crescit virtute, et praxi, decrescit. Semper plus vigoris, et industria[e], semper, semper.

marginalia.translation: He who does not grow in virtue and practice, dwindles. Always more vigor and industry, always, always.

position.marginalia_text: Proprius quidam habitus virilis fortitudinis, profunda[e] prudentia[e], et diuina[e] Constantia[e]: ab hoc Principio viuendi ad finem vsq[uam] vita[e]. Vita non est vita sed miseria; sine foelicitate vel externa,

marginalia.translation: A certain particular habit of manly fortitude, profound prudence, and divine perseverance: from this beginning of living towards the end of life anywhere. A life is not life but a misery without hapiness, either external or at least internal.

position.marginalia_text: Nihil viro tam Necessarium, quàm quotidiana
la[e]titia, exercitatio, sudor. Nullus sine sudore dies.

marginalia.translation: Nothing is as necessary for a man as daily joy, exercise, and hard labour. No days without sweat.

position.marginalia_text: Solus sapiens vtitur omnibus peritè: etiam abusu: et rectè procedit contra Curvu[m].

marginalia.translation: Only a wise man uses everything skillfully, also in abuse. And he proceeds straight against that which is crooked.
